data.title: Best Deli in Waren
data.text: This is a deli/party store, not a restaurant.  When our son graduated from high school and MSU, we ordered our chicken from Chicago Deli for the graduation parties.  It was the best, so tender and juicy, and reasonably priced.  For take home, they do have individual chicken dinners and dinners for smaller groups.  They make their sandwiches on the spot, so they are always fresh.  They have soups and some hot foods, and each day they have daily specialties.

data.title: I've been coming here since I was a kid.
data.text: ****I wanted to give 5 stars across the board, but my crap phone won't chose 5 so I have to settle for 4.  I've been coming to Chicago Deli since the early 1980's, back when they had an ice cream window! Lol. The staff at Chicago Deli are always super friendly and they have GOOD food. I recommend the chicken piece dinner. The chicken here is AMAZING! I know, I know...how can party store chicken be good?? I don't know how. I don't know why. It's just DELICIOUS!!!!!!

data.title: Good sandwiches and super friendly service in this Deli / Liquor Store.
data.text: Dropped into Chicago Deli whilst on business in Warren to pick up some sandwiches for lunch. I bought 3 sandwiches, Beef & Cheddar, Turkey & Swiss, and Ham & Cheese... All were good but nothing exceptional.  Service was friendly from a big guy with a beard and prices were reasonable at around the $4 mark.  The Deli counter also serves hot food and is located at the back of what is a liquor / convenience store.  This is not a 'restaurant' but a take-away place so don't go expecting to dine in.

data.title: Chicago  Deli
data.text: When you goin Chicago Deli you feel like you are ready I'll head home and get ready just grab your plates on the table everything is home cooked and delicious I recommend this to anyone that needs a bite to eat with short time a lot of time and this sandwich thing I have is called a Stromboli is like the best

data.title: Great Takeout
data.text:
The food counter at Chicago Deli is a great change from the burger & fries or grinder  one might have for lunch.  My favorite is the chicken breat dinner which includes a bread stick, and either broasted potatoes (huge mega-fries) or macaroni & cheese.  Also pizza by the slice as  well as various sandwiches. Add a bottled beverage and you are set to go. 

Not expensive, but it is take-out ...SO.....go three-tenths of a mile east to Campell  Street (take a right) and go four tenths of a mile south to  LICHT PARK where (weather permitting) you can enjoy your lunch under towering trees & the Michigan sky. 

Chicago Deli is around a 1/2 mile east of the GM Technical Center in Warren where Chicago Rd and 13 Mile merge.

data.title: You feel welcome!
data.text:
From the minute you walk in, usually "Mike" behind the counter, acknowleges you in a friendly way.  The deli has the best broasted chicken . . . to die for!  Every deli item is fresh and good.  Absolutely love this place.  What's great for me is that it's one block from my home, but would travel 50 miles for their broasted chicken!

Ruth G.

data.title: Party trays are the BEST
data.text: I run over here for their cheese bread for lunch.  I order the veggie lasagne for parties.  We've had them cater lunches here at work - the service is really good, they are really nice folks and the food is always great!
